messages.content: What is the purpose of ComfyUI-segment-anything-2?
ComfyUI-segment-anything-2 is a custom node in ComfyUI that allows users to segment anything in an image using the Segment Anything Model (SAM).
Where can I find the PointsEditor for testing ComfyUI-segment-anything-2?
The PointsEditor for testing ComfyUI-segment-anything-2 is available in the KJNodes repository on GitHub, located at https://github.com/kijai/ComfyUI-KJNodes.
ComfyUI-segment-anything-2 is functional but currently in testing phase. It needs a better coordinate selector and has mask postprocessing disabled due to the need for CUDA extension compilation.
Where are the models for ComfyUI-segment-anything-2 downloaded from?
The models for ComfyUI-segment-anything-2 are automatically downloaded from https://huggingface.co/Kijai/sam2-safetensors/tree/main.
Where are the downloaded models for ComfyUI-segment-anything-2 stored?
The downloaded models for ComfyUI-segment-anything-2 are stored in the 'ComfyUI/models/sam2' directory.
What is the original repository for the Segment Anything Model (SAM)?
The original repository for the Segment Anything Model (SAM) is located at https://github.com/facebookresearch/segment-anything-2.
Can ComfyUI-segment-anything-2 be used for mask postprocessing?
Currently, mask postprocessing is disabled in ComfyUI-segment-anything-2 due to the need for CUDA extension compilation. However, other nodes can be used for this purpose.
